intro: Pseuduvaria philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is typically found in lowland and montane rainforests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local communities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
